title: Minimum Swaps to Arrange a Binary Grid
content: Given an binary , in one step you can choose two adjacent rows of the grid and swap them. A grid is said to be valid if all the cells above the main diagonal are zeros. Return the minimum number of steps needed to make the grid valid, or -1 if the grid cannot be valid. The main diagonal of a grid is the diagonal that starts at cell and ends at cell . is 0 or 1
